creator: thoth@incanta.net
text:
The script tomcat/bin/antRun has #!/bin/sh^M for its first line.

This causes RPM to calculate a dependency for /bin/sh and for /bin/sh^M which
leads to the following error message:

[root@gonzo hammor]# rpm --install jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3-1.i386.rpm 
error: failed dependencies:
 is needed by jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3-1

(it's really saying "/bin/sh^M is needed by jakarta-"...)

which is rather hard to diagnose.

I suggest you remove the carriage returns from the unix scripts.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Should be fixed in 3.3 ( since ant.sh is no longer included :-)
Probably a mistake during the build.
( ant is no longer included in bin lib because it's not used )
